content: Given an adjunction (F : C ⥤ D) ⫞ (G : D ⥤ C) where G takes values in a reflective subcategory E of C, is there an easy way to restrict it to an adjunction between E and D? Something like R ⋙ F ⫞ G ⋙ L where L : C ⥤ E and R : E ⥤ C are the reflector and inclusion of E in C. This seems general enough that I would hope that it's in mathlib already, but I haven't been able to find it so far and don't even really know what terms to search for
it would be if E was coreflective instead of reflective
but with E being reflective, the adjunctions don't quite line up
I think that would work, yeah. It's not quite the same statement, but seems applicable enough if I'm understanding it right
i.e., taking iC to be the inclusion of E into C, iD to be the identity and L' ⫞ R' to be the adjunction F ⫞ G should result in the restriction I was asking for
Ben Eltschig has marked this topic as resolved.
